meanings.definition: More fragile or delicate in constitution or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The flower was frailer than the others in the garden.
meanings.sent2: She felt frailer after the illness.
meanings.sent3: The frailer teacup broke easily when dropped.
meanings.sent4: His frailer health made him more susceptible to colds.
meanings.sent5: The frailer branches swayed in the gentle breeze.

meanings.definition: A person who is physically weak or delicate.
meanings.sent1: The frailer needed assistance climbing the stairs.
meanings.sent2: She was considered one of the frailers in the group.
meanings.sent3: The frailer struggled to lift the heavy box.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the hero protected the frailer from harm.
meanings.sent5: The frailer always carried a small first aid kit with them.

meanings.definition: To become weaker or more delicate.
meanings.sent1: With age, his health began to frailer.
meanings.sent2: The fabric will frailer if not handled gently.
meanings.sent3: The vase started to frailer as it aged.
meanings.sent4: His resolve did not frailer even in the face of adversity.
meanings.sent5: The friendship started to frailer as they grew apart.
